name: ITP009-6 - Trenching and Installation of Conduits
template name: ITP009-6 - Trenching and Installation of Conduits

name: 1.0 Trenching and Installation of Conduits (Primary and Secondary)
1.1 - Preparation for the Works to be Undertaken
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure survey set out is undergone, trench route marked out, excavation permit obtained and (if required) services in work(s) area isolated.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006
Acceptance Criteria: Any services in the vicinity of work area(s) to be isolated to the satisfaction of the Principal and other relevant authorities.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006
• Trenches for conduits shall be excavated to the width and depth required enabling construction of the conduits to the requirements specified on the drawings.
• The level at the bottom of the trench shall not be above the required level at any point.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006
Acceptance Criteria: Where conduit ends are not open to a pit, UPVC end caps shall be temporarily fitted to each end. Number of conduits and duct route to be confirmed for conformity with design.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006
Frequency: Prior to backfilling each lot
Acceptance Criteria: Surveyor to pick up completed conduit runs before backfill
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006 / Survey Report
Acceptance Criteria: Trenches shall be backfilled with bedding sand as per construction drawings, followed by clean fill.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006
• Prior to backfilling to top of trench, warning tape shall be installed on top conduits, not less than 150mm wide and 0.1mm thick.
• They shall be orange/white in colour and bear “CAUTION ELECTRIC / COMMUNICATION BELOW” or similar repeatedly in black letter not less than 30mm high.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed / Avionics Checklist 006
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
